channel.title: AI-Pulse - IoT - Internet of Things
channel.description: IoT - Internet of Things news from AI-Pulse

item.title: Community spotlight: MyEmbeddedStuff
item.description: One of the things we love most about the Arduino community is the way knowledge flows freely – makers, engineers, and hobbyists sharing what they’ve learned so others can build on it. Case in point, the in-depth technical analyses coming from MyEmbeddedStuff, a blog dedicated to embedded systems written by an engineer with over seven […]

item.title: From Connected Devices to Autonomous Operations: What Enterprise IoT Is Really Becoming
item.description: The latest IoT Analytics report reveals enterprise IoT's shift from connectivity projects to embedded, autonomous operations focused on resilience, ROI, and operational intelligence across industries.

item.title: L’IA va booster l’internet des objets
item.description: L'IA va booster l'internet des objets. Une récente étude Verizon indique que 84 % des entreprises considèrent l’IA comme une technologie clé pour l’IoT, et surtout, 70 % affirment qu’elle a concrètement accéléré leurs déploiements.

item.title: Serial Studio: see data from Arduino, ESP32, Raspberry Pi, and other devices in real-time
item.description: Serial Studio is a tool that helps you see data from Arduino, ESP32, Raspberry Pi, and other devices in real-time. It works with serial ports (UART), Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), MQTT, Modbus TCP/RTU, CAN Bus, TCP/UDP networks, and audio devices. You can create dashboards to monitor sensors and debug hardware without writing code. Serial Studio […]

item.title: A platform-independent embedded C++ library for terminal/shell implementation
item.description: EmbeddedTerminal is a new platform-independent C++ library for embedded systems by GitHub user boeserfrosch. It provides a terminal/shell implementation with command parsing, file system abstraction, and network interfaces. Works across Arduino, ESP-IDF, and native platforms. See the latest release on GitHub.

item.title: Telit Cinterion Showcases CMB100 and eSIM at MWC 2026
item.description: At MWC Barcelona 2026, Telit Cinterion will demonstrate its CMB100 embedded modem and NExT eSIM technology, highlighting innovations in IoT connectivity, global deployments, and edge intelligence for mission-critical applications.

item.title: Seco to Demo IoT and Software Framework at Embedded World
item.description: Seco will showcase Clea, its IoT and AI software framework, at embedded world 2026, through a series of interactive demonstrations. The modular software framework simplifies the adoption of edge AI at scale by connecting hardware, software, and AI into a single, production-ready ecosystem. It supports the entire edge AI process from application development to deployment [...]

item.title: Everyday Productivity Challenges in IoT Projects and How Teams Solve Them
item.description: IoT project teams face challenges like device integration delays, data inconsistencies, and security disruptions. Adopting standards, automation, and scalable practices improves productivity and project success.

item.title: Texas Instruments to acquire Silicon Labs
item.description: Texas Instruments will acquire Silicon Labs in a $7.5 billion cash deal, merging their embedded wireless and analog capabilities to enhance IoT connectivity and manufacturing efficiency, targeting accelerated growth and customer reach.

item.title: IoT Data Collection in ATEX Environments
item.description: Key Insights (AI-assisted): Tightening integration between intrinsically safe hardware and modern connectivity is shifting hazardous-area IoT from niche pilots to scalable deployments. As ATEX smartphones gain full cellular, GNSS, and sensor stacks, the bottleneck moves from device capability to interoperability with SCADA, MDM, and line-of-business applications. This forces OT and IT teams to converge architectures and security models, particularly on private LTE/5G.

item.title: Introducing the latest Arduino App Lab release
item.description: We’re excited to introduce a new version of Arduino App Lab, designed to make building, testing, and sharing applications easier and more secure. This update centers around enhancing the flexibility of App Lab, so you can focus on what’s important: building – whether you’re a student, educator, or experienced maker working with the Arduino UNO […]

item.title: This Twister-inspired coffee table controls things resting on it
item.description: Smart home and IoT devices are nice and all, but controlling them always feels a bit clunky. It seems like it always comes down to trying a voice command and then, when that fails, opening an app on a smartphone and pushing a button. That’s why Unnecessary Inventions’ Matty Benedetto came up with this much […]

item.title: la maison intelligente en vedette au CES de Las Vegas
item.description: A l'occasion du CES de Las Vegas ( 6-9 janvier ) le fabricant Coréen Samsung s'apprete à frapper fort dans le domaine de la maison intelligente .

item.title: IRobot jette l’éponge
item.description: Depuis plus de dix ans , la maison. numérique connectée utilisait un Irobot avec satisfaction. Solidité, facilité d’entretien, L’iRobot était à nos yeux l’un des plus sérieux aspirateurs robots. Nous utiisons presque quotidiennement un ROOMBA. Evidemment plus lourd, plus encombrant ,plus bruyant mais tellement plus fiable ! La société iRobot, née au Massachusetts à la […]

item.title: IoT et domotique
item.description: Le fournisseur de semi-conducteurs japonais Renesas Electronics renforce sa famille de microcontrôleur basse consommation RA avec des circuits de connectivité pour l’IoT et la domotique.

item.title: Smart Home au CES 2026
item.description: L'un des principaux sujets d'intérêt du Consumer Electronics Show de Las Vegas (6-9 janvier) sera, cette année encore, celui de la domotique.

item.title: démocratiser la maison intelligente
item.description: C’est le pari de quelques enseignes comme IKEA ou LIIDL… rendre accessible au plus grand nombre des solutions de controle/commande accessibles et utiles. Enfin l’acces aux solutions connectées pour la maison va connaitre une baisse significative des couts. Vers une domotique accessible au plus grand nombre… Il aura plusieurs dizaines d’années pour y parvenir..( la […]

item.title: marché des capteurs 3D
item.description: La popularité croissante des technologies de la maison connectée, notamment les appareils à commande gestuelle et les systèmes de sécurité résidentiels améliorés, ouvre de nouvelles perspectives pour les applications des capteurs 3D. Dans le domaine de l’électronique grand public, pour les smartphones et les tablettes, les capteurs d’image 3D sont indispensables pour des fonctionnalités avancées […]
